Decisions are made by the executive, which includes the President and vice-presidents, who set the priorities for regional policy. These subjects are then submitted to a vote in the 'parliament', which consists of plenary assemblies and permanent commissions. The elected officials' votes result in the drafting of deliberations, which are legal acts that become enforceable. Before being voted on, subjects requiring expertise are reported on by administrative services and discussed in thematic commissions of regional elected officials.
